definitions.definition: (of a person) control the functioning of (a machine, process, or system).
examples: a shortage of workers to operate new machines

definitions.definition: (of a machine, process, or system) function in a specified manner.
examples: market forces were allowed to operate freely
synonyms: be operative More"the machine ceased to operate"take effect
function "the way the law operates in practice"

examples: there is a powerful law that operates in politics

definitions.definition: (of a person or organization) manage and run (a business).
examples: many foreign companies operate factories in the U.S
synonyms: be in control/charge of "he operated the mine until 1931"

definitions.definition: (of an organization) be managed and run in a specified way.
examples: neither company had operated within the terms of its charter

definitions.definition: (of an armed force) conduct military activities in a specified area or from a specified base.
examples: the mountain bases from which the guerrillas were operating

synonyms: do an operation; informalput under the knife "doctors decided to operate"
